attributes.action: Better support in Schools for SEN needs/ neurodivergent children.
attributes.additional_details: I want change. So many of the same stories of parents waiting for help, diagnosis and issues in school. This takes a toll on parents and children's mental health. VERY SAD.
attributes.background: Better support for neurodivergent children, as the system is failing children in mainstream schools. Resulting in children being permanently excluded, parents giving up work due to lack of support. It's 2023 the curriculum/education should be doing  better, should be helping shape lives not destroy.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Require education staff to be trained on learning disabilities and autism: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/639050

Increase protections for SEN children and young adults: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/651147

Identify common needs in EHCPs and require schools to support these by default: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/644291

Regular SEN training for educational staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/649405

If there is something else you would like the Government to do you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
